Multiple social media posts: The claim was circulated on various social media platforms, including Twitter and Facebook, by multiple users and pages, indicating a widespread dissemination of the information.
Images of the wounded woman: The claim was accompanied by images of a woman with visible injuries, which were shared along with the narrative of a Hindu woman being attacked by a Muslim man.
Circulation by influential individuals: The claim was shared by users who are followed by Railway Minister Piyush Goyal’s Office and BJP Delhi spokesperson Tajinder Singh Bagga, suggesting that it gained traction and credibility through association with influential individuals.
Verification by authorities: To verify the claim, Alt News contacted the Gopalganj District Magistrate, who confirmed that the arrested individual was not a member of the Muslim community, contradicting the communal narrative being propagated.
